dashboard-import.existing-library-panels-desc: List of existing library panels These panels are not affected by the import.
dashboard-import.new-library-panels-desc: List of new library panels that will get imported
dashboard-import.uid-desc: The unique identifier (UID) of a dashboard can be used for uniquely identify a dashboard between multiple Grafana installs. The UID allows consistent URLs for accessing dashboards so that changing the title of a dashboard will not break any bookmarked links to that dashboard.
dashboard-import.view-selection-tooltip: Do not change the pre-selected view.

edit-panel.actual-description: Make same size as on the dashboard
edit-panel.apply-tooltip: Apply changes and go back to dashboard

legend.values-description: Select values or calculations to show in legend

edit-panel.library-panels-description: Reusable panels you can share between multiple dashboards.

panel-options.repeat-by-variable-description: Repeat this panel for each value in the selected variable. This is not visible while in edit mode. You need to go back to dashboard and then update the variable or reload the dashboard.

query.empty-query-edit-warning: An empty query name is not allowed

query-options.interval-tooltip: The evaluated interval that is sent to data source and is used in <1>$__interval</1> and <4>$__interval_ms</4>. This value is not exactly equal to <7>Time range / max data points</7>, it will approximate a series of magic number.
query-options.max-data-points-tooltip: The maximum data points per series. Used directly by some data sources and used in calculation of auto interval. With streaming data this value is used for the rolling buffer.
query-options.min-interval-tooltip: A lower limit for the interval. Recommended to be set to write frequency, for example <2>1m</2> if your data is written every minute. Default value can be set in data source settings for most data sources.
query-options.relative-time-tooltip: Overrides the relative time range for individual panels, which causes them to be different than what is selected in the dashboard time picker in the top-right corner of the dashboard. For example, to configure the Last 5 minutes the Relative time should be <1>now-5m</1> and <3>5m</3>, or variables like <5>$_relativeTime</5>.
query-options.time-shift-tooltip: Overrides the time range for individual panels by shifting its start and end relative to the time picker. For example, to configure the Last 1h the Time shift should be <1>now-1h</1> and <4>1h</4>, or variables like <6>$_timeShift</6>.

tooltip.hover-proximity-description: How close the cursor must be to a point to trigger the tooltip, in pixels

save-dashboard.cant-save-provisioned: This dashboard cannot be saved from the BMC Helix Dashboards because it has been provisioned from another source. Copy the JSON or save it to a file below. Then you can update your dashboard in the provisioning source.
save-dashboard.curr-time-as-default: Save current time range as dashboard default.
save-dashboard.curr-var-as-default: Save current variable values as dashboard default.
save-dashboard.description-placeholder-text: Add a note to describe your changes.

errors.dash-folder-same-name: Dashboard name cannot be the same as folder name.

edit-form.all-panels-desc: Send the annotation data to all panels that support annotations.
edit-form.all-panels-except-desc: Do not send annotation data to the following panels.
edit-form.color-desc: Colour to use for the annotation event markers
edit-form.enabled-desc: When enabled, the annotation query is issued at every dashboard refresh.
edit-form.hidden-desc: Annotation queries can be toggled on or off at the top of the dashboard. With this option checked, this toggle will be hidden.

filter-by.dashboard-desc: Query for events created on this dashboard and show them in the panels where they where created.
filter-by.tags-desc: This will fetch any annotation events that match the tags filter.

query-editor.match-any-desc: Enabling this returns annotations that match any of the tags specified below.

query-type.annotation-desc: Show annotations or alerts managed by Grafana.

query-editor.tag-field-desc: <0>Specify a list of tags to match. To specify a key and value tag, use `key:value` syntax.</0>

edit-form.selected-panels-desc: Send the annotations to the explicitly listed panels.

annotation.info-body:
Annotations provide a way to integrate event data into your graphs. They are visualized as vertical lines
          and icons on all graph panels. When you hover over an annotation icon, you can get event text & tags for
          the event. You can add annotation events directly from Grafana by holding CTRL or CMD + click on graph (or
          drag region). These will be stored in Grafana's annotation database.
annotation.info-body-doc-link: Checkout the <0>annotations documentation</0> for more information.
annotation.title: There are no custom annotation queries added yet.

settings.confirm-delete-text: Do you want to delete this dashboard?

dashboard-link-list.html-text: Dashboard links allow you to place links to other dashboards and web sites directly below the dashboard header.

links.description-edit-link: Edit a specific link of your dashboard.

editor.exlude-variable-desc: Select to exclude the variable from the query.
editor.include-all-desc: Enables an option to include all variable values.
editor.multi-value-desc: Enables multiple values to be selected at the same time.

ad-hoc-filters.description: Add key/value filters on the fly.

data-source.description: Enables you to dynamically switch the data source for multiple panels.

data-source.name-filter-desc1: Regex filter for which data source instances to choose from in the variable value list. Leave empty for all.

internal.auto-option-description: Dynamically calculates interval by dividing time range by the count specified.
internal.min-interval-description: The calculated value will not go below this threshold.
internal.step-count-description: How many times the current time range should be divided to calculate the value
internal.title: Interval options

query.refresh-desc: When to update the values of this variable

query.sort-desc: How to sort the values of this variable

name.description: The name of the template variable (max. 50 characters)

variables.info-body: Variables enable more interactive and dynamic dashboards. Instead of hard-coding things like server or sensor names in your metric queries. you can use variables in their place. Variables are shown as list boxes at the top of the dashboard. These drop-down lists make it easy to change the data being displayed in your dashboard. Check out the <0>templates and variables documentation</0> for more information.

variable-editor-list-row.exclamation-triangle-title: This variable is not referenced by any variable or dashboard.

query-editor.control-rules: The selected target data source must export a query editor.

query-editor.error-text: The selected data source could not be loaded.
query-editor.query-description: Define the query that is run when the link is clicked. You can use <2>variables</2> to access specific field values.
query-editor.query-editor-title: Data source does not export a query editor.

source-form.description: You have used the following variables in the target query: <1></1><2></2>A data point needs to provide values to all variables as fields or as transformations output to make the correlation button appear in the visualization. <4></4>Note: Not every variable needs to be explicitly defined below. A transformation such as <7>logfmt</7> will create variables for every key/value pair.
source-form.heading: Variables used in the target query
source-form.results-description: The link will be shown next to the value of this field.
source-form.source-description: Results from selected source data source have links displayed in the panel.
source-form.sub-text: <0>Define what data source will display the correlation, and what data will replace previously defined variables.</0>
source-form.title: Configure the data source that will link to {{dataSourceName}} (Step 3 of 3).

correlations.sub-title: Define how data living in different data sources relates to each other. Read more in the <2>documentation<1></1></2>.

target-form.sub-text: <0>Define what data source the correlation will link to, and what query will run when the correlation is clicked.</0>
target-form.target-description: Specify which data source is queried when the link is clicked.
target-form.title: Setup the target for the correlation (Step 2 of 3).

trans-details.logfmt-description: Parse provided field with logfmt to get variables.
trans-details.regex-description: Field will be parsed with regex. Use named capture groups to return multiple variables, or a single unnamed capture group to add variable to named map value. Regex is case insensitive.
trans-details.regex-expression: Use capture groups to extract a portion of the field.
trans-details.regex-map-values: Defines the name of the variable if the capture group is not named.

transform-row.expression-tooltip: Required for regular expression. The expression the transformation will use. Logfmt does not use further specifications.
transform-row.field-tooltip: Optional. The field to transform. If not specified, the transformation will be applied to the results field.
transform-row.map-value-tooltip: Optional. Defines the name of the variable. This is currently only valid for regular expressions with a single, unnamed capture group.
transform-row.type-tooltip: The type of transformation that will be applied to the source data.

alert-rules-drawer.subtitle: Alert rules related to this dashboard.

empty.add-library-panel-body: Add visualizations that are shared with other dashboards.

acknowledgment-checkboxes.ack-title: Before you make the dashboard public, acknowledge the following:
acknowledgment-checkboxes.data-src-ack-desc: Publishing currently only works with a subset of data sources*.
acknowledgment-checkboxes.data-src-ack-tooltip: Learn more about public data sources.
acknowledgment-checkboxes.public-ack-desc: Your entire dashboard will be public*.
acknowledgment-checkboxes.usage-ack-desc: Making a dashboard public will cause queries to run each time it is viewed, which may increase costs*.

create-page.unsupported-features-desc: Currently, we don’t support template variables or frontend data sources.

delete-modal.revoke-nonorphaned-body-text: Are you sure you want to revoke this URL? The dashboard will no longer be public.

modal-alerts.save-dashboard-changes-alert-title: Please save your dashboard changes before updating the public configuration.
modal-alerts.unsupport-data-source-alert-readmore-lin: Read more about supported data sources.
modal-alerts.unsupported-data-source-alert-desc: There are data sources in this dashboard that are unsupported for public dashboards. Panels that use these data sources may not function properly: {{unsupportedDataSources}}.
modal-alerts.unsupported-template-variable-alert-desc: This public dashboard may not work since it uses template variables.

settings-configuration.default-time-range-label-desc: The public dashboard uses the default time range settings of the dashboard.

query-operation.query-editor-not-exported: Data source plugin does not export any Query Editor component.

aria-label.choose-interval: Auto refresh turned off. Choose refresh time interval.
aria-label.duration-selected: Choose refresh time interval with current interval {{durationAriaLabel}} selected.

search-input.include-panels-placeholder: Search for dashboards, folders, and panels.

embed.html-description: The HTML code below can be pasted and included in another web page. Unless anonymous access is enabled, the user viewing that page need to be signed into BMC Helix Dashboards for the graph to load.
embed.info: Generate HTML for embedding an iframe with this panel.
embed.time-range-description: Transforms the current relative time range to an absolute time range.

link.info-text: Create a direct link to this dashboard or panel, customized with the options below.
link.render-instructions: To render a panel image, you must install the <1>Grafana image renderer plugin</1>. Please contact your Grafana administrator to install the plugin.
link.save-dashboard: To render a panel image, you must save the dashboard first.
link.time-range-description: Transforms the current relative time range to an absolute time range.

snapshot.deleted-message: The snapshot has been deleted. If you have already accessed it once, then it might take up to an hour before before it is removed from browser caches or CDN caches.
snapshot.info-text-1: A snapshot is an instant way to share an interactive dashboard publicly. When created, we strip sensitive data like queries (metric, template, and annotation) and panel links, leaving only the visible metric data and series names embedded in your dashboard.
snapshot.info-text-2: Keep in mind, your snapshot <1>can be viewed by anyone</1> that has the link and can access the URL. Share wisely.
snapshot.name: Snapshot name
snapshot.timeout-description: You might need to configure the timeout value if it takes a long time to collect your dashboard metrics.

share-playlist.checkbox-description: Panel heights will be adjusted to fit screen size.
share-playlist.title: Share playlist

content.empty-recent-list-docs: <0><0>Read the documentation</0><1> to find out more about how to enter custom time ranges.</1></0>
content.empty-recent-list-info: It looks like you haven't used this time picker before. As soon as you enter some time intervals, recently used intervals will appear here.

copy-paste.default-error-message: {{error}} is not a valid time range.

range-content.default-error: Please enter a past date or "now".

empty.add-transformation-body: Transformations allow data to be changed in various ways before your visualization is shown. <1></1>This includes joining data together, renaming fields, making calculations, formatting data for display, and more.
